text:
Hi everyone, I'm using the MLJ package to train an SVM on a 100x3500 dataset with a binary target variable. I am searching for the optimal values of :cost and :gamma using a 3x3 grid (using the function TunedModel()). Although that works fine, when I increase the resolution of the grid to 4 or over, the whole session crashes. I get a very quick error message on the REPL before it terminates and the following pop-up message appears (see below). I have used this method to tune other models over grids of much larger size (hundreds and even thousands of grid cells in total). Any idea of what might be happening? I am using VSCode v1.52.1

The terminal process "C:\Users\ivica\AppData\Local\Programs\Julia\Julia-1.4.2\bin\julia.exe '-i', '--banner=no', '--project=c:\Users\ivica\Documents\GitHub\Mozzie_diagnostics', 'c:\Users\ivica.vscode\extensions\julialang.language-julia-1.0.10\scripts\terminalserver\terminalserver.jl', '\.\pipe\vsc-julia-repl-21120', '\.\pipe\vsc-jl-cr-21120', 'USE_REVISE=true', 'USE_PLOTPANE=true', 'DEBUG_MODE=undefined'" terminated with exit code: 1.

<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65277479/vscode-terminal-crashes-when-training-hyperparameters-of-machine-learning-model?noredirect=1#comment115413140_65277479|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65277479/vscode-terminal-crashes-when-training-hyperparameters-of-machine-learning-model?noredirect=1#com[…]7479>

Hi everyone, I'm using the MLJ package to train an SVM on a 100x3500 dataset with a binary target variable. I am searching for the optimal values of :cost and :gamma using a 3x3 grid (using the function TunedModel()). Although that works fine, when I increase the resolution of the grid to 4 or over, the whole session crashes. I get a very quick error message on the REPL before it terminates and the following pop-up message appears (see below). I have used this method to tune other models over grids of much larger size (hundreds and even thousands of grid cells in total). Any idea of what might be happening? I am using VSCode v1.52.1

The terminal process "C:\Users\ivica\AppData\Local\Programs\Julia\Julia-1.4.2\bin\julia.exe '-i', '--banner=no', '--project=c:\Users\ivica\Documents\GitHub\Mozzie_diagnostics', 'c:\Users\ivica.vscode\extensions\julialang.language-julia-1.0.10\scripts\terminalserver\terminalserver.jl', '\.\pipe\vsc-julia-repl-21120', '\.\pipe\vsc-jl-cr-21120', 'USE_REVISE=true', 'USE_PLOTPANE=true', 'DEBUG_MODE=undefined'" terminated with exit code: 1.

text:
<@U01CLK6GX96>. Have you resolved this issue?
If not what version of `MLJ` and `MLJLIBSVMInterface` are you using ? What tables type are you using?
Am guessing your Operating system terminated your julia procesess probably due to insufficient resources?
Try reducing the number of folds

text:
<@UAZP7LJLU> thanks for your reply. No, I haven't solved it yet...

I am using `MLJ` v0.15.1 and `MLJLIBSVMInterface` v0.1.1, and I am using the same table types as in <https://alan-turing-institute.github.io/DataScienceTutorials.jl/isl/lab-9/index.html> (X is `Tables.MatrixTable{Array{Float64,2}}` and y is `CategoricalArray{Int64,1,UInt32,Int64,CategoricalValue{Int64,UInt32},Union{}}` ).

I have reduced the number of folds down to 3 and the behaviour is still the same.

I am using this exact same dataset to tune other models (LogisticClassifier and EvoTreesClassifier), and each tuning instance optimises hyperparameters by looking at hundreds, sometimes thousands of models. This one, however, crashes the session when I go over a grid bigger than 3x3. Would this happen if the problem was insufficient resources?

text:
<@U01CLK6GX96> try again twice.
In the first run set the verbosity to 0 while in the second run set the verbosity to 5.
That ought to tell what's wrong.
verbosity can be set using
`fit!(tuning_mach, verbosity=0)`

text:
I find it really hard to read the output because the session crashes...

It may look like setting `verbosity` to `5` is what causes the problem, but sometimes it also crashes with `verbosity=0`, I don't think it has anything to do with it. When `resolution` is higher than `3` it always crashes, when it's `3` it only does sometimes...

text:
Hmm. So you are running on Windows.
I can see an `EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION` from the stacktrace from your video.
I don't think this is a `MLJ`  issue. This issue could be caused by
1. corrupted  `LIBSVM` C++ library. (Try `] rm  LIBSVM.jl` , delete the corresponding files from `~/.julia/artifacts` and reinstall `LIBSVM.jl`.)
2. It could also be that your RAM is faulty. Run a PC diagnostic test to check if your RAM is faulty. Also try Running the same program on another PC to see if you get the same error. 
3. An Antivirus may also be causing the issue. Try disabling the antivirus and see if it resolves your issue. 
The following <https://knowledgebase.progress.com/articles/Article/3790|article> give a more complete list of reasons.
